intro: Willoughbya scandens var. orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco willow. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae, characterized by its woody stems and showy yellow flowers. Native to South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia, it thrives in moist, tropical environments. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological benefits in wetland habitats.
